0f9c1312-d773-45bb-9d54-7ef0fc4f58a9.content: Plugin architecture to keep the core concept abstract and allow for specific customizations for each user/need

c88262d6-21ba-41bd-aab7-51b96d0ed062.content: Follow VS Code model: built-in extensions use same API as marketplace extensions, all can be disabled by users

970270c0-d817-4e71-83f4-f540cffd4673.content: Directory structure: src/renderer/plugins/ with core/ (registry, interface, context), builtin/ (ships with app), external/ (future user-installed)

4429d7ba-34ea-48e6-bef4-1dea1c350562.content: Each plugin has manifest.json: { name, version, displayName, enabled: true, builtin: true }

f4d54505-4c01-48a1-804d-d9afbc27151f.content: Plugin interface defines standard API: initialize(), dispose(), getContextMenuItems(), getSessions(), sendToSession(), getNodeIndicator()

cf30ace6-5743-47c9-ad11-33506bb23c09.content: Process isolation: plugins run separately from UI (like VS Code extension host)

5bcba9ad-828d-4d4e-b661-89504c00e097.content: Lazy loading: plugins activate only when needed (not at startup)

d789b040-ce74-4e38-8793-d9fe46b0e96f.content: Claude integration is built-in but optional - can be disabled if user doesn't use Claude Code

e99c471a-ab13-475a-b8f9-b98edf0920af.content: Same architecture works for future external plugins (Gemini, Copilot, custom community plugins)

bd4e87a5-132a-484d-82f0-52b6de115e60.content: Clean separation: plugin crashes don't break tree core, easy to test core independently

plugin-refactor-critical-001.content: Unsafe private API access: ExtensionHostConnection.ts:173-178 accesses _invokeHandlers (private Electron API)

plugin-refactor-critical-001-b.content: Solution: Create proper IPC bridge with public APIs. Use dedicated channel for plugin IPC calls with own event emitter.

plugin-refactor-high-001.content: Massive code duplication in PluginProxy.ts - 4 methods with identical 30-line implementations (136 lines â†’ ~40 lines possible)

plugin-refactor-high-001-a.content: Issue: provideNodeContextMenuItems, provideNodeIndicator, provideSidebarPanels, provideToolbarActions all duplicate error handling and IPC call logic

plugin-refactor-high-001-b.content: Solution: Create generic invokeExtension<T>() helper. Reduce to 4 one-liners calling the helper.

plugin-refactor-high-002.content: Type safety issues - 50+ type casts, unknown payloads without validation across codebase

plugin-refactor-high-002-a.content: Issue: extensionHost.worker.ts, ExtensionHostConnection.ts, PluginAPI.ts use 'as' casts liberally. No runtime validation.

plugin-refactor-high-002-b.content: Solution: Define proper TypeScript interfaces for all message payloads. Add Zod/io-ts runtime validation at boundaries.

plugin-refactor-high-003.content: Missing abstraction layer for worker thread communication - direct PluginAPI coupling

plugin-refactor-high-003-a.content: Issue: Plugins directly access global.pluginAPI with hardcoded access patterns. Tight coupling to worker implementation.

plugin-refactor-high-003-b.content: Solution: Create PluginContext class injected into plugin constructors. Abstract IPC calls behind clean API.

plugin-refactor-medium-001.content: Error handling inconsistency - Mix of console.error, logger.error, throw, silent failures

plugin-refactor-medium-001-a.content: Solution: Standardize on logger everywhere. Define error policy: log + return { success: false } or throw?

plugin-refactor-medium-002.content: IPC handler duplication in extensionHostIpcHandlers.ts - Repetitive try/catch/logger patterns in 6 handlers

plugin-refactor-medium-002-a.content: Solution: Create wrapHandler() higher-order function for error handling, logging, response formatting

plugin-refactor-medium-003.content: Message ID generation inconsistency - Different patterns in ExtensionHostConnection.ts and PluginAPI.ts

plugin-refactor-medium-003-a.content: Solution: Create shared generateMessageId() utility with UUID or nanoid instead of counters

plugin-refactor-medium-004.content: No timeout configuration - Hardcoded 30000ms timeouts in multiple files

plugin-refactor-medium-004-a.content: Solution: Move to shared constants file. Make configurable for development vs production.

plugin-refactor-medium-005.content: ExtensionHostManager lifecycle complexity - Multiple async guards (startPromise, started flag) could race

plugin-refactor-medium-005-a.content: Solution: Use state machine library (xstate) or enum-based state. Single source of truth for lifecycle state.

plugin-refactor-medium-006.content: No plugin dependency management - Plugins can't declare dependencies on each other or load order

plugin-refactor-medium-006-a.content: Solution: Add dependencies field to manifest. Topological sort on registration. Future: plugin APIs exposed to other plugins.

plugin-refactor-medium-006-b.content: Effort: Medium (4-5 hours). Affects: PluginRegistry.ts, manifest schema, initialization flow

plugin-refactor-low-001.content: Naming inconsistency: 'Extension Host' vs 'Plugin' terminology mixed throughout codebase

plugin-refactor-low-001-a.content: Solution: Pick one term. 'Extension Host' is implementation detail. Use 'Plugin' in user-facing code. Effort: 1-2 hours.

plugin-refactor-low-002.content: Missing plugin unload/reload during development - Must restart app to test plugin changes

plugin-refactor-low-002-a.content: Solution: Add hot reload support. Watch manifest/plugin files. Unregister/re-register on change. Effort: 3-4 hours.

plugin-refactor-low-003.content: No plugin metrics/telemetry - Can't track performance, errors, or usage patterns per plugin

plugin-refactor-low-003-a.content: Solution: Wrap extension calls with metrics collection. Track: call count, duration, errors, memory. Effort: 2-3 hours.

plugin-refactor-low-004.content: pathToFileURL import only used once - Minor: Could inline or comment why needed for worker threads

plugin-refactor-low-005.content: PluginRegistry missing from architecture - Mentioned in docs but implementation unclear/incomplete

plugin-refactor-low-005-a.content: Solution: PluginRegistry exists with clear separation from PluginManager. Updated architecture.md to document both.

plugin-refactor-low-006.content: Mock event object in handleIPCCall - Creates fake IPC event, may not have all properties real events have

plugin-refactor-low-006-a.content: Solution: After fixing private API access (critical-001), this becomes moot. Document why mock needed if kept. Effort: 30 mins.

plugin-refactor-critical-001-a.content: Issue: Fragile and could break on Electron version upgrades. No type safety.

febab53e-cebd-44d6-8d7d-431f0710e791.content: Implement webview-based UI system for plugin sidebars/panels (VS Code pattern)

399423a9-df74-4d84-8e8f-b8bbd857fae8.content: Design webview container component - isolated iframe with sandboxing, similar to VS Code webviews

fcf2d6d2-f85e-4dc7-ae73-4583c09db89b.content: Implement message passing system - postMessage API between plugin webview and main app

0dd5351f-535e-4860-ad32-e7f08eb8987e.content: Replace open invokeIPC() with typed API methods - Current PluginContext exposes entire IPC layer via invokeIPC(channel, ...args), allowing plugins to call ANY internal IPC channel. Replace with typed API surface (getProjectPath(), showNotification(), etc.) to restrict plugin access to approved APIs only.

6fab1a58-6725-4cdf-baf5-8784d4ba9487.content: Add API versioning - Add apiVersion field to manifest and check compatibility at load time. Enables detecting incompatible plugins and warning users about version mismatches.

19a90e4b-61aa-4f1c-b0f0-9282975318d3.content: Add permission model in manifest - Add permissions array to manifest.json declaring required capabilities (workspace:read, notifications:show, claude:sessions:read). Enables permission review and potential future permission prompts.
